challengeName: Brivo WordPress Theme Template Continuation Challenge
detailedRequirements: Welcome to the Brivo WordPress Theme Template Continuation Challenge! We already built the initial fully functional WordPress theme for Brivo. For this Challenge the goal is to continue building the templates of the provided WordPress theme with the pages outlined in this challenge. The end result should be fully functional WordPress theme with all its data editable/configurable through WP-Admin.
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Challenge Guidelines

The overall goal of this challenge is to complete the templates, pages, and functionality of the provided WordPress theme that our outlined below. 

Page Instructions

1) Overall Pages
- Cover photos on all page should utilize the built-in Featured Image features of WordPress. If there's no uploaded file, assign a default image cover photo, you can use any existing cover photo image and this can be a background in CSS file.
- mobile layout version is also part of the challenge scope
- make sure that content videos are also responsive 

2) About Us
- update this page to have a side sidebar menu, use wp nav menu
- sidebar menu items are: Overview, Company Team, Careers, Blog, Media, and Sustainability
- Overview nav is the "About Us" page
- Create dummy page for these pages except for Careers, the Careers page is outlined below    

3) Careers
- see the provided careers page asset
- top content (the text that has careers@brivo ... up to the two buttons), are the main content that come from the content editor in WP Admin
- sections below are as follows, make sure all text are editable and not hardcoded in template file.

- "We're Disruptors Hiring (More) Disruptors" section: 
-- this is a custom field with WYSIWYG editor for its content
-- use sample video for the video placeholder
-- "Watch Brivo Video" button will be deadlink for now.

- "I'm a headline about working in Bethesda" section:
-- this is a custom field with WYSIWYG editor for its content
-- videos are also custom fields, make sure that we can add unlimited number of videos (check the repeater feature of Advance Custom Field plugin)
-- create and use shortcode to display these video in a carousel, make sure that only video uploaded to this page should get displayed

- "I'm a headline about Perks" section:
-- this is a custom field with WYSIWYG editor for its content
-- create and use shortcode for displaying the Perks tiles, see the existing "Product & Solutions" page for reference on how the tiles works. The content for these tiles will come from the Perks post type.

- "Open Positions" section:
-- this is a custom field with WYSIWYG editor for its content
-- create and use shortcode to display open positions content sorted by menu order, these content will come from the "Open Positions" post type
-- each open position item are toggable to display/hide the content details of each item.

- "Get Started" section:
-- this is a custom field with WYSIWYG editor for its content
-- the button "jobs@brivo.com" will be an email link

- "Meet the Brivo Team" section:
-- this is a custom field with WYSIWYG editor for its content
-- remove the carousel part and replace it with a button with label "Meet the Team" that links to Team page
-- this button should be aligned center in the page, the style will be similar to "jobs@brivo.com" button above    

4) Solutions
- these pages will be templates for the rest of the Solutions post type
- see the provided Solutions assets for template layout reference
- get the actual content from http://www.brivo.com/solutions

- complete the following pages for this post type:
-- Property Management
-- Federal Government
-- Retail
-- Education
-- State & Local Government
-- Commercial Offices
-- Health Care
-- Manufacturing (use dummy text content for now for this page)

- top content:
-- this will be the actual content that usually comes from the content editor of WP Admin
-- this content starts with "Brivo Solutions Powerful. Simple. Security"
-- followed by page title (e.g. Property Manage)
-- then followed by the description, this is usually the first large paragraph from the actual site
-- the content will be up to the 3 buttons, use deadlinks for the meantime

- "Product Solutions for..." section:
-- this is a custom field with WYSIWYG editor for its content
-- link the learn more to the actual product category page (e.g http://xtranetbrivo.wpengine.com/Products/brivo-onair-healthcare/)
-- use dummy video content for the video placeholder

- "Benefits for..." section:
-- this is another custom field with WYSIWYG editor for its content
-- this section also includes any brochure file download. In case of more than 1 file download, each item should be inlined with each other, see 03_State and Local Government_PC.png for reference

- "Case Study" section:
-- there should be a way to select 2 Case Study post type
-- the selected case study will display the post title of the Case Study and embed the video
-- title will link to the Case Study post

- "Additional Case Studies" section:
-- there should be a way to select 4 Case Study post type
-- thumbnail image will link to the Case Study post

- "What Customer Said About our Products" section:
-- this is a carousel but this is already existing functionality
-- there is also an existing shortcode "[customer-testimonials]" to show this carousel, you need to update this to add a category attribute
-- if shortcode is used and no category attribute, it will get Testimonial post type regardless of category
-- if category is set, it will return only testimonials with specific category
-- if category is set and there's no returned post type, it will query regardless of category.

- Button section
-- There should be additional custom fields for the 2 buttons at the bottom of the page
-- should have fields for labels and links 

5) Case Study
- these pages are from Case Study post types
- link to each post type page will come from Solutions page described above
- top content cover photo will use the featured image
- "Print this case" - should show print friendly 
- "Export to PDF" | "Email this Case" | "Share this Case" - propose a better way to achieve their functionality
- sections below are from the repeating custom fields, class name should be applied as well to implement their styles

- "Related Case Studies" 
-- this will pull related Case Study post types based on tags
-- it should return all related post type items
-- in case there are more than 3 items returned, a carousel should be implement. 

Post Types

1) Perks
- should have the basic Title, Content Editor, and Post Thumbnail fields
- should have an extra field for Teaser (text)
- this functions similar to "Solutions" post type, check that out for reference 

2) Open Positions
- should have the basic Title, Content Editor, and menu order
- should have an extra field if this position is still open or not
- get the content of each position from the Opportunites section of this page http://www.brivo.com/about-us/careers 

3) Case Studies
- should have the basic Title, Content Editor, and Post Thumbnail fields
- Post Thumbnail/Feature Image will be used as the cover image on top part of the page
- there should be Tags as a basis of related Case Study
- there should be repeater custom field group that has WYSIWYG editor and text field for entering class name 

4) Testimonials
- update this custom post type to have a custom taxonomy as category, use the same category/Solutions found in Products post type

Theme Requirements

General Rules
- It is important to use the LESS file (brivo.less) in creating your CSS. Use grunt or another autocompiler or pre-processor to watch the LESS files for changes and automatically compile them in the background. Some example of autocompiler are WinLESS and LESS.app
- Utilize any exisitng styles and functionality, do not introduce new code that has the same functionality or styles from the provided theme
- Test in all the required browsers.
- Watch word typos in every place including the source code. Make sure they have correct meaning.
- DO NOT render any CSS properties from JavaScript functions. 

WordPress Guidelines
- Your project should use the provided theme, this is based from Roots starter theme. (http://roots.io/starter-theme/) This theme includes the latest Bootstrap, and utilizes LESS for CSS. A tutorial for getting started with Roots can be found here. (http://roots.io/roots-101/)
- Follow the Roots method for structuring your theme. Wherever you might need to have duplicate markup and queries, use get_template_part() to move this section to its own template file. These files should be saved in a /templates/ directory. Compartmentalize your structure wherever possible.
- Menus should be implemented with WordPress menus when required.
- Create and utilize a custom page template whenever possible and applicable. 

HTML/CSS Requirements:
- Your HTML code must be HTML5 compliant
- Validate your code - reviewers may accept minor validation errors, but please comment your reason for any validation errors.
- The generated CSS file from LESS file should be validated for errors
- Use the validators listed in the scorecard.
- Use CSS to space out objects, not clear/transparent images (GIFs or PNGs) and use proper structural CSS to lay out your page. Only use table tags for tables of data/information and not for page layout.
- No inline CSS styles - all styles must be placed in an external stylesheet.
- Use semantically correct tags - use H tags for headers, etc. Use strong and em tags instead of bold and italic tags.
- Element and Attribute names should be in lowercase and use a "-" or camel naming to separate multiple-word classes (i.e.. "main-content", or "mainContent)
- Label all CSS or HTML hacks with explanations so others will understand.
- Your code must render properly in all browsers listed in the scorecard in both Mac and PC environments. 

Interaction Guidelines
All Javascript/Interactive elements described above must be implemented in your submission. Any libraries required should be included in your Roots-based theme, but should not be compiled with Grunt into a single file. All libraries should be included in the Theme through the standard WordPress script/styles include method, wp_enqueue_script() and wp_enqueue_style(). 

  • All JavaScript must not have a copyright by a third party. You are encouraged to use your own scripts, or scripts that are free, publicly available and do not have copyright statements or author recognition requirements anywhere in the code.
  • You are allowed to use the jQuery JavaScript library for this contest.
  • Label all JavaScript hacks with explanations so others will understand.

Wordpress Plugins and Helpers

  • For custom fields, use the existing Advance Custom Fields plugin in creating new custom fields 
  • For theme options, use the existing Redux in creating new/required theme option fields
  • You are allowed to use open source WordPress Plug-ins and/or Helpers. Use the existing assets if the purpose or functionality of this plugin/helpers already exists.
  • Document your plug-ins and/or helpers and what they are used for.

Browsers Requirements

  • IE9+
  • Latest FF Mac & PC
  • Latest Safari Mac & PC
  • Latest Chrome Mac & PC
  • Android Tablet
  • Android Phone
  • iPhone
  • iPad

Submission Deliverables

  • Detailed deployment instructions.
  • A WordPress theme is a folder containing all the images, css, javascript, and PHP files that describe the appearance and layout of a WordPress blog. The PHP files have a standard naming convention for page types. 
  • You must include any necessary plug-in files along with the necessary configuration settings.
